body:
What do you think about bringing prestiges back

I think they were a wicked idea and made it more competitive and fun.
body_tagged:
What do you think about bringing prestiges back

I think they were a wicked idea and made it more competitive and fun.
title: Bringing prestiges back

replies.body: F*** no, I just wasted my new after-ban life on Avicus for getting 100k credits and I don't want to loose my 75k now. It was the same when Kylo updated Avicus and removed prestiges... If we loose our earned credits now again, then it's time to leave
replies.body_tagged: F*** no, I just wasted my new after-ban life on Avicus for getting 100k credits and I don't want to loose my 75k now. It was the same when Kylo updated Avicus and removed prestiges... If we loose our earned credits now again, then it's time to leave

replies.body:
Prestige should be the name for a rank-up system Avicus could have. After a certain amount of credits earned or the certain level's 'challenges' are completed you rank up or prestige and unlock new stuff.

How does that sound to y'all?
replies.body_tagged:
Prestige should be the name for a rank-up system Avicus could have. After a certain amount of credits earned or the certain level's 'challenges' are completed you rank up or prestige and unlock new stuff.

How does that sound to y'all?

replies.body: But what happens to the badges? They would be not needed anymore... They should be refunded
replies.body_tagged: But what happens to the badges? They would be not needed anymore... They should be refunded

replies.body:
I talked to Kylo a while back, and he adressed that prestiges will not be returning. 

rip.

replies.body: What were prestiges? I don't think I ever knew what that was lol
replies.body_tagged: What were prestiges? I don't think I ever knew what that was lol

replies.body: Like once you get to 50 levels you confirm your prestige, and you get a different coloured * each time.
replies.body_tagged: Like once you get to 50 levels you confirm your prestige, and you get a different coloured * each time.

replies.body:
How about we talk about moving forward, not backward! People have suggested some pretty awesome new ideas like challenges and dynamic ranking unlike prestiges which were subject to complaints because they were "repetitive", limited and "unrewarding."

Edit: linked wrong thread, summarized it
